For some reason the output of the last line in the function set() is 47 while the value of "i" is 33. The last 15 bytes are filled with garbage value. I want that the length of beany.str should be equal to the length of *testing.

" OwnerUserId="4638139" LastActivityDate="2015-03-05T20:27:38.327" Title="Passing structure by reference and assign string" Tags="" AnswerCount="2" CommentCount="0"/>

"Adobe Reader could not open 'xxx.pdf' because it is either not a supported file type or because the file has been damaged (for example, it was sent as an email attachment and wasn't correctly decoded)."

Below is my code

public static void PopulatePDF(byte[] PDFcontents)
{
    var response = HttpContext.Current.Response;

    response.AppendHeader("Content-Disposition", "inline; filename=xxx.pdf");
    response.AppendHeader("Content-Length", PDFcontents.Length.ToString());
    response.AppendHeader("Content-Transfer-Encoding", "binary");

    response.OutputStream.Write(PDFcontents,0,contents.PDFcontents);
    response.BufferOutput = true;
    response.Buffer = true;

    response.ContentType = System.Net.Mime.MediaTypeNames.Application.Pdf;

    response.BinaryWrite(PDFcontents);

    response.Flush();
    response.End();
}

The method did pass data (byte[2100217]) and display the pdf in the browser. But the tricky part is that it couldn't be opened from the downloaded file at local after "Save" was used.

Not sure what happened in between. Is this due to the version of Adobe Reader I'm using? It's Adobe Reader XI (version 11.0.10).

" OwnerUserId="4019968" LastEditorUserId="1364007" LastEditDate="2015-03-05T20:28:11.787" LastActivityDate="2015-03-05T20:28:11.787" Title="Opening generated PDF after saving it in browser" Tags="" AnswerCount="0" CommentCount="3"/> " OwnerUserId="1051104" LastActivityDate="2015-03-05T20:26:05.977" CommentCount="0"/> " OwnerUserId="2578042" LastActivityDate="2015-03-05T20:28:11.360" CommentCount="0"/> "(?:\\.|[^"])*"

Demo

For each character in the string, match either a backslash followed by anything, or a character that is not a quote.

And if you need something optimized, here's an alternative:

"(?>[^\\"]++|\\.)*+"

Demo

It basically uses possessive quantifiers to avoid backtracking.

" OwnerUserId="3764814" LastEditorUserId="3764814" LastEditDate="2015-03-06T21:58:38.777" LastActivityDate="2015-03-06T21:58:38.777" CommentCount="0"/>

PS: I put in the BODY's "overflow:hidden;" because I was testing that out too. Just a FYI. :-)

<html>
<head>
<title>Test</title>
<style>
.p1 {   position:absolute;
                top:50px;
                left:50px;
                border: 1px solid grey;
                padding: 5px;
                font-family: sans-serif,Arial,Helvetica,Verdana,"Trebuchet MS",Tahoma,"MS Sans Serif",Geneva;
                font-size: 12pt;
                width: 150px;
                height: 10pt;
                overflow: hidden;
                z-index:0;
            }
</style>
</head>
<body style='overflow:hidden;'>
<div id='d1' name='d1' style="width:500px;height:400px;overflow:hidden;z-index:1;
    border:1px solid black;clip: rect(1px 1px 1px 1px);clip:rect(1px,1px,1px,1px);">
<p id='p1' name='p1' class='p1'>This is a test of how HTML works</p>
<p id='p2' name='p2' class='p1'>This is a test of how HTML works</p>
<p id='p3' name='p3' class='p1'>This is a test of how HTML works</p>
</div>
<script>
function moveIt(n)
{
    document.getElementById("p1").style.left = n;
    document.getElementById("p2").style.top = n;
    document.getElementById("p3").style.left = n;
    document.getElementById("p3").style.top = n;
//  document.getElementById("d1").style.transform = "rotate(" + n + "deg)";
    if( n < 2000 ){ setTimeout("moveIt(" + (n + 1) + ")", 1 ); }
        else { moveIt2(n); }
}
function moveIt2(n)
{
    document.getElementById("p1").style.left = n;
    document.getElementById("p2").style.top = n;
    document.getElementById("p3").style.left = n;
    document.getElementById("p3").style.top = n;
//  document.getElementById("d1").style.transform = "rotate(" + n + "deg)";
    if( n > -1000 ){ setTimeout("moveIt2(" + (n - 1) + ")", 1 ); }
        else { moveIt(n); }
}
    moveIt(50);
</script>
</body>
</html>

" OwnerUserId="4406793" LastActivityDate="2015-03-05T20:34:03.053" CommentCount="0"/> Buy ticket opens a page blank. What can be?

    This my code, one simple exemple:

<?php   

    /*firts include sdk of facebook*/
    include_once "../sdks/facebook-php-sdk-master/src/facebook.php";


    /*for testing, i am using one event (id) of metallica */
    $id ="385101904985590";

    /*create new object*/
    $facebook = new Facebook(array(
              'appId'  => 'my_app_id',
              'secret' => 'my_code_secret',
              'cookie'=>true 

            ));
    /*verify user*/
    $user = $facebook->getUser();

    /*get ticket_uri by id */
    $ticket_uri  = $facebook->api('/'.$id.'?fields=ticket_uri');

    /*show a array*/
    echo "<pre>";
       print_r($ticket_uri );
    echo "</pre>";

    /* 




     is perfect, but the ticket_uri, not opens, opens a page blank. 
    [ticket_uri] => Array
            (
                [ticket_uri] => https://www.facebook.com/ajax/events/ticket.php?event_id=385101904985590&source=12&ext=1425586199&hash=ATWt4bCv2S6KB7J7
                [start_time] => 2015-05-09T21:00:00-0700
                [id] => 385101904985590
            )

    */

?>

" OwnerUserId="4100215" LastEditorUserId="4100215" LastEditDate="2015-03-05T20:50:47.703" LastActivityDate="2015-03-05T20:50:47.703" Title="Ticket_uri of event facebook opens in blank. What can be?" Tags="" AnswerCount="0" CommentCount="1"/> for the strings to be evaluated:

" OwnerUserId="2082964" LastEditorUserId="2082964" LastEditDate="2015-03-06T06:42:51.680" LastActivityDate="2015-03-06T06:42:51.680" CommentCount="4"/>

I want to write the same thing without PHP tags. I know that {$eventObj|strtotime} will send eventObj to strtotime", but how do I sent the result of this to date as the second parameter?

I couldn't find anything in the docs on sending the result of a modifier as the second parameter of another modifier. I could only find applying two modifiers to the same thing.

I tired putting parentheses and playing with the colon syntax but it wouldn't work. I need to just ask someone.

Thanks!

" OwnerUserId="1763217" LastActivityDate="2015-03-05T20:44:29.030" Title="How to I send a modified variable as the second parameter of a function in Smarty 2?" Tags="" AnswerCount="0" CommentCount="0"/>

Here is my css:

.plan-again {
  margin-right: 30px;
  a {
    color: #861a08
  }
}

.plan-again-text {
  font-family: 'IM Fell Great Primer', serif;
  font-size: 2em;
}

So if I use float right on both... they wind up being on the same line which I think makes sense. What I want is for them both to be on the right side of my page and on top of each other. Is there anyway else besides doing like adding 

margin 400px?

to my css?

" OwnerUserId="2714301" LastActivityDate="2015-03-05T20:56:16.877" Title="CSS problems. How do I move two elements to the right and keep them in different blocks?" Tags="" AnswerCount="2" CommentCount="1"/>

If I click on the "Animals" category, it should display on the Horizontal JList "Big animal, with big ears and long nose." and on the Vertical JList "Man's best Friend.", just to put an example.

How do I do this? *It is for a crossword puzzle btw.

Edit: when the App starts, the JLists are empty.

" OwnerUserId="3828853" LastEditorUserId="992484" LastEditDate="2015-03-05T21:09:28.183" LastActivityDate="2015-03-05T21:09:28.183" Title="Add JList Items based on JComboBox selection" Tags="" AnswerCount="1" CommentCount="1"/>

In the glyphs panel (within Illustrator) the "M" character I want to use is: U+004d Alternates#2 (aalt2)

I have this currently in my CSS:

.script:before {
content: "\004D";
}

Unfortunately, this code does not pull the alternate "M" I want. It just pulls the default "M" that I'm trying to get rid of.

Is this even possible to call an alternate "M" from a font, and display it on a web page?

" OwnerUserId="4638467" LastActivityDate="2015-03-05T22:35:13.587" Title="Is it possible to display an alternate character with CSS?" Tags="" AnswerCount="2" CommentCount="2"/>

Then add this div into your markup here:

<div class="plan-again-text">
  Didn't find the perfect trip? Let's plan again.
</div>
<div class="clearfix"></div>
<div class="plan-again">
  <%= link_to "Let's Plan Again.", new_planner_path, class: "btn btn-primary" %>
</div>

You can look into Bootstrap's clearfix here, and even implement their LESS mixin.

http://getbootstrap.com/css/#helper-classes-clearfix

I wrote this little info page a while back for some co-workers helping to explain clears and floats. Perhaps you might find it useful.

http://robabby.github.io/lunch-and-learn/clear-float.html

" OwnerUserId="977203" LastActivityDate="2015-03-05T20:56:16.877" CommentCount="0"/>
